title: Ferrero makes progress in traceability, recycling initiatives
summary: Ferrero Group, a confectionery company, has made significant strides in sustainability by increasing traceability in its supply chains, improving packaging recyclability, and reducing water use in its manufacturing plants. These efforts, highlighted in the company's sustainability report, demonstrate their commitment to environmental responsibility and responsible sourcing across their operations.

title: Encouraging businesses to adopt ESG values
summary: The Star Media Group ESG Positive Impact Awards 2022 (ESG PIA 2022) recognized 100 companies for their commitment to sustainability, with awards presented in 15 categories across the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) pillars. Geomax won Gold in Responsible Consumption and Production under the Environment pillar and Heineken Malaysia won the award for "The Most Outstanding ESG Initiatives of The Year" for the "Large Companies" category.

title: Passionate About Our Planet
summary: Tottenham Hotspur has committed to the UN Race to Zero, aiming to halve its carbon emissions by 2030 and reach net zero by 2040. The club has measured its Scope 3 emissions, which account for over 90% of its total greenhouse gas emissions, with fan travel being the most significant source. Tottenham Hotspur is developing a decarbonization action plan to address these emissions through engagement with suppliers, fans, and internal policy changes.

greenwashing: The article does not suggest any misleading or false claims about environmental benefits, so it does not present an example of greenwashing.

title: FERRERO GROUP'S 15th SUSTAINABILITY REPORT DEMONSTRATES SOLID PROGRESS AS COMPANY ACCELERATES EFFORTS TO MEET ITS TARGETS
summary: Ferrero Group, a global confectionery company, has released its 15th Sustainability Report, showcasing advancements in responsible sourcing, environmental protection, and community empowerment. The report highlights achievements in hazelnut and cocoa traceability, reaching 90% and 93% respectively, demonstrating commitment to sustainable practices throughout its supply chain. Ferrero also emphasizes its work on packaging recyclability, achieving 90.7% of packaging being recyclable, reusable, or compostable.

title: Arushi Rawat
summary: Vikram Pawah, CEO of BMW Group India, notes the growing luxury car market in India fueled by a new generation of wealthy entrepreneurs. He highlights the increasing demand for both ICE and EV luxury vehicles from this segment, particularly in Tier II and Tier III cities.  These young entrepreneurs are less hesitant to spend on luxury products and services, driving growth in the sector.
